CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 9, 1961, pg. 2, reads: "First in Neighborhood - Located at 1560 E. Ohio St., North Side, this three-story structure was the scene of many racial incidents when Negroes moved into the previously all-white neighborhood. At the time it was managed by DePaul Smith and James Bruff. - Harris Photos."  Portion of accompanying article reads: "Smith Filled Need Ignored by Public?  Editor's note: While Pittsburgh (The Renaissance City) proudly displays its renovation of the Golden Triangle, highlights by the $22 million Civic Arena, to its many citizens and visitors, and maps magnificent plans for 'urban renewal, it has 'swept under the rug its 'dregs of human misery' - those displaced persons, a majority of whom are Negroes, who either have not been relocated or are unable to find suitable housing on their own.  Crack Courier reporter Phyl Garland has gone behind the scenes to interview and write about these 'Prisoners of the Ghetto' and their vicious 'jailer.'  This is the third in a series of articles which The Courier offers its readers..."
TitMainTitle: Exterior of four story brick row house with mansard roof, 1560 East Ohio Street, Northside
